defaultEvents.description: What is the future of technology? AI? Death? Come join us for a seminar with the heads of Apple stationed in Hawaii.

Come meet us in the cafeteria for a chat and hackathon with the possibility to win a summer internship in Silicon Valley. Google is an American multinational technology company that specializes in Internet-related services and products, which include online advertising technologies, a search engine, cloud computing, software, and hardware.
Lets eat brunch and talk about electronics! Everyone who attends this event will receive a free brunch from Heavenly.

defaultProfiles.bio: Google is an American multinational technology company that specializes in Internet-related services and products, which include online advertising technologies, a search engine, cloud computing, software, and hardware.
defaultProfiles.title: Company

defaultProfiles.bio: Cisco Systems, Inc. is an American multinational technology conglomerate corporation headquartered in San Jose, California. Integral to the growth of Silicon Valley, Cisco develops, manufactures and sells networking hardware, software, telecommunications equipment and other high-technology services and products.
defaultProfiles.title: Company

defaultProfiles.bio: First Hawaiian, Inc. is a bank holding company headquartered in Honolulu, Hawaiʻi. Its principal subsidiary, First Hawaiian Bank, founded in 1858, is Hawaiʻi’s oldest and largest financial institution headquartered in Honolulu, Hawaiʻi, at the First Hawaiian Center. The bank has 57 branches throughout Hawaiʻi, three in Guam and two in Saipan. It offers banking services to consumer and commercial customers, including deposit products, lending services and wealth management, insurance, private banking and trust services.
defaultProfiles.title: Company

defaultProfiles.bio: Samsung is a major manufacturer of electronic components such as lithium-ion batteries, semiconductors, image sensors, camera modules and displays for clients such as Apple, Sony, HTC and Nokia. It is the world's largest manufacturer of mobile phones and smartphones, started with the original Samsung Solstice and later, the popularity of its Samsung Galaxy line of devices.
defaultProfiles.title: Company

defaultProfiles.bio: Apple Inc. is an American multinational technology company that specializes in consumer electronics, computer software and online services.
defaultProfiles.title: Company

defaultProfiles.bio: I like to paddle outrigger canoes.
In my spare time, I like to scuba dive.
Every summer, I enjoy visiting Portland, Oregon.
I escaped from Chicago and moved to Hawaii in 2014.
Most weekends, you can find me on my 8 foot dinghy.
defaultProfiles.title: Ph.D. (2020)

defaultProfiles.bio: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023.
defaultProfiles.title: Student

defaultProfiles.bio: I am studying for a B.S. in Mathematics in the Department of Mathematics at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2021.
defaultProfiles.title: Student

defaultReports.description: fake-person@hawaii.edu has included vulgar content in her profile page.
app1e@app1e.com is masquerading as my company on the site. They are posting events that do not exist and are slandering my company's name on the page they've made. Please take them down.
I came across the user (fake-person2@gmail.com) who has put rather offensive content in their profile description.

While searching through students' profiles for potential job candidates, I came across a user by the name Jason Leigh (leighj@hawaii.edu). When I clicked the link to his portfolio page, I was sent somewhere unexpected and I think I may have downloaded a virus. Please look into the matter and contact us when you know more.

defaultProjects.description: Growing awesome computer scientists, one graduate at a time.

defaultProjects.name: Cyber Canoe
defaultProjects.description: Software for Unity projects involving stereoscopic resolution driven by 9 PCs with a GeForce 980 graphics card.

defaultJob.description: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, extraordinary ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple’s University Recruiting team is looking for a highly motivated, engineering students with a strong background in Back-End Engineering, Core OS, and Web Development to join its team of highly skilled software engineers.

defaultJob.jobTitle: Full Stack Engineer Summer 2022 Internship, Bachelors
defaultJob.description: Summer Internship (May - August 2022), full-time work schedule, Monday- Friday 40 hours per week.  As a Full Stack Engineer at Meraki, you will help craft and build features for Meraki's Dashboard - the window to the entire Meraki experience. From Dashboard, our customers can control their entire Meraki stack: access points, switches, firewalls, client devices, cameras, and more. You will work across the stack with other developers, UX designers, and product management to build and improve the Dashboard web application. Meraki engineers put the customer experience first, own projects from beginning to end, and are empowered to make impactful decisions.

Assist with curing delinquent First Hawaiian Bank loans by contacting customers via phone or written correspondence.  Recognize accounts/relationships that pose a credit risk and recommend or take prudent actions to reduce the bank's exposure.  Responsible for providing excellent service to delinquent customers and to work in concert with the relationship officers to best service our delinquent loans.

Under the direction of the Retail Banking Regional Manager, Business Banking Market Manager or Team Leader, provide client servicing, credit support for the Business Banking Team including the preparation of client correspondence, credit requests, financial analysis and loan administration.  Assist in credit administration, along with the sale and servicing of related products and services.  Emphasis on learning credit skills including financial analysis of business and personal income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow, risk ratings, and compliance.
